member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.DownloadFiles(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.IEnumerable,ComponentPro.IO.FileSystem,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Downloads files from the specified remote directory to the destination directory on the destination file system using multiple threads.
member.param: The path and name of the remote directory where the files will be downloaded to the destination folder. When the parameter is null reference, this parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are downloaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be downloaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be downloaded. If "/mydir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "/mydir" will be downloaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the remote directory should be downloaded. The final search condition depends on the and settings of the parameter. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!

The list of files and directories to download, or null to transfer files in the that match the search condition specified in the parameter. This can contain and objects. (e.g. DownloadFiles("", false, new string[] {"/dir/file1", "file2", "dir1" }...) or DownloadFiles("", false, new object[] {"file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 }...))

Indicates whether the containing directory should also be created in the destination directory. For example: DownloadFiles("/MyDir/*.txt", true, null, zipSystem, "/ZipDir" ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is created in "ZipDir" and all files and dirs within "MyDir" are copied to "ZipDir/MyDir"; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not created in "ZipDir", only files and subdirectories within "MyDir" are copied to "ZipDir".
The destination file system that receives the files from the server.
The path of the destination directory on the destination file system to receive files from the server.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
The number of threads used for the file transfer.

A boolean value indicating whether to wait for the completion of all threads. If this parameter is true, this method will block the caller process's execution until all threads have completed; otherwise, this method will immediately return the control to the caller process.
member.returns: A object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

Indicates whether all files and subdirectories will be transferred.
Specifies the action taken on existing files.
Specifies the action taken on symlinks.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.DownloadFiles(System.String,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.SearchCondition)
member.summary: Downloads files in the specified remote directory to the local directory.
member.param: The path and name of the remote directory where the files will be downloaded to the local folder. This parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are downloaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be downloaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be downloaded. If "/mydir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "/mydir" will be downloaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the remote directory should be downloaded. The final search condition is a combination of the masks, if found, in the and the parameters. If this value ends with '>', the containing directory will also be downloaded. For example, if "/folder>" is used, files and subdirectories of "/folder" directory and itself will be downloaded; the destination directory will contain "folder" directory and its contents. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!
The path of the local directory to receive files from the server.

The search conditions to match against the files, or a null reference to download all files and subdirectories. The final search condition is a combination of this parameter and the masks, if found, in the parameter.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.UploadFiles(ComponentPro.IO.FileSystem,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Uploads files from the specified source directory on the specified source file system to the specified remote directory using multiple threads.
member.param: The source file system containing files to upload.

The path and name of the directory on the source file system where the files will be uploaded to the server. When the parameter is null reference, this parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are uploaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be uploaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be uploaded. If "/mydir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "/mydir" will be uploaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. The final search condition depends on the and settings of the parameter. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!

Indicates whether the containing directory should also be created in the destination directory. For example: UploadFiles(zipSystem, "MyDir/*.txt", true, null, "/RemoteDir" ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is created in "RemoteDir" and all files and dirs within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir/MyDir"; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not created in "RemoteDir", only files and subdirectories within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir".

The list of files and directories to upload, or null to upload files in the that match the search condition specified in the parameter. This list can contain and objects. (e.g. UploadFiles(zipSystem, "", false, new string[] {"/dir/file1", "file2", "dir1" }...) or UploadFiles(zipSystem, "", false, new object[] {"/dir/file1", fileInfo2, dirInfo1 }...))
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
The number of threads used for the file transfer.

A boolean value indicating whether to wait for the completion of all threads. If this parameter is true, this method will block the caller process's execution until all threads have completed; otherwise, this method will immediately return the control to the caller process.
member.returns: A object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

The list of files and directories to upload, or null to upload files in the that match the search condition specified in the parameter. This list must comprise file paths in and/or instances. (e.g. string[] files = new string[] {"file1", "file2", "dir1" } or object[] files = new string[] {"file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 })
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.

If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. The final search condition depends on the and settings of the parameter. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!

Indicates whether the containing directory should also be created in the destination directory. For example: UploadFiles(zipSystem, "MyDir/*.txt", true, null, "/RemoteDir" ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is created in "RemoteDir" and all files and dirs within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir/MyDir"; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not created in "RemoteDir", only files and subdirectories within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir".

The list of files and directories to upload, or a null reference to upload files in the that match the search condition specified in the parameter. This can contain and objects. (e.g. UploadFiles(zipFileSystem, "", false, new string[] {@"/file1", @"/folder/file2", @"dir1" }, ...) or UploadFiles(zipFileSystem, "", false, new object[] {@"/temp/file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 }, ...))
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.UploadFiles(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions)
member.summary: Uploads files from the specified local directory to the specified remote directory.
member.param: The path and name of the local directory where the files will be uploaded to the server. When the parameter is null reference, this parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are uploaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be uploaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be uploaded. If "c:\mydir\*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "c:\mydir" will be uploaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. The final search condition depends on the and settings of the parameter. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!

Indicates whether the containing directory should also be created in the destination directory. For example: UploadFiles("MyDir/*.txt", true, null, "/RemoteDir" ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is created in "RemoteDir" and all files and dirs within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir/MyDir"; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not created in "RemoteDir", only files and subdirectories within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir".

The list of files and directories to upload, or a null reference to upload files in the that match the search condition specified in the parameter. This can contain and objects. (e.g. UploadFiles(null, false, new string[] {@"d:\file1", @"c:\folder\file2", @"d:\dir1" }, ...) or UploadFiles(null, false, new object[] {@"d:\temp\file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 }, ...))
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.UploadFiles(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions)
member.summary: Uploads local files or directories in the list to the specified remote directory.
member.param: The list of files and directories to upload. This list can contain and objects (e.g. UploadFiles(new string[] {"c:\data\file1", "c:\text\doc.txt", "c:\dir1" }, ...) or UploadFiles(new object[] {"file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 }, ...)). This cannot be null or empty.
The path of the remote directory to store the uploaded files.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.UploadFiles(System.String,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions)
member.summary: Uploads files from the specified local directory to the specified remote directory.
member.param: The path and name of the local directory where the files will be uploaded to the server. This parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are uploaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be uploaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be uploaded. If "c:\mydir\*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "c:\mydir" will be uploaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. The final search condition depends on the and settings of the parameter. If this value ends with '>', the containing directory will also be uploaded. For example, if "/folder>" is used, files and subdirectories of "/folder" directory and itself will be uploaded; the destination directory will contain "folder" directory and its contents. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.UploadFilesAsync(System.String,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,ComponentPro.ExtendedAsyncCompletedEventHandler{ComponentPro.IO.FileSystemTransferStatistics},System.Object)
member.summary: Asynchronously uploads files from the specified local directory to the specified remote directory.
member.param: The path and name of the local directory where the files will be uploaded to the server. This parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are uploaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be uploaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be uploaded. If "c:\mydir\*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "c:\mydir" will be uploaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. The final search condition depends on the and parameters of the parameter. If this value ends with '>', the containing directory will also be uploaded. For example, if "/folder>" is used, files and subdirectories of "/folder" directory and itself will be uploaded; the destination directory will contain "folder" directory and its contents. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
An optional asynchronous callback to be invoked when this operation completes. This parameter can be null.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An asynchronous reference to a object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.UploadFilesAsync(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,ComponentPro.ExtendedAsyncCompletedEventHandler{ComponentPro.IO.FileSystemTransferStatistics},System.Object)
member.summary: Asynchronously uploads files from the specified local directory to the specified remote directory.
member.param: The path and name of the local directory where the files will be uploaded to the server. When the parameter is null reference, this parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are uploaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be uploaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be uploaded. If "c:\mydir\*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "c:\mydir" will be uploaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. The final search condition depends on the and settings of the parameter. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!

Indicates whether the containing directory should also be created in the destination directory. For example: UploadFilesAsync("MyDir/*.txt", true, null, "/RemoteDir" ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is created in "RemoteDir" and all files and dirs within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir/MyDir"; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not created in "RemoteDir", only files and subdirectories within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir".

The list of files and directories to upload, or a null reference to upload files in the that match the search condition specified in the parameter. This can contain and objects. (e.g. UploadFilesAsync(null, false, new string[] {@"d:\file1", @"c:\folder\file2", @"d:\dir1" }, ...) or UploadFilesAsync(null, false, new object[] {@"d:\temp\file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 }, ...))
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
An optional asynchronous callback to be invoked when this operation completes. This parameter can be null.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An asynchronous reference to a object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

member.summary: Asynchronously uploads files from the specified source directory on the specified source file system that match the search condition specified in the option parameter to the specified remote directory.
member.param: The source file system containing files to upload.

The path and name of the directory on the source file system where the files will be uploaded to the server. When the parameter is null reference, this parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are uploaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be uploaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be uploaded. If "/mydir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "/mydir" will be uploaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. The final search condition depends on the and settings of the parameter. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!

Indicates whether the containing directory should also be created in the destination directory. For example: UploadFilesAsync(zipSystem, "MyDir/*.txt", true, null, "/RemoteDir" ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is created in "RemoteDir" and all files and dirs within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir/MyDir"; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not created in "RemoteDir", only files and subdirectories within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir".

The list of files and directories to upload, or a null reference to upload files in the that match the search condition specified in the parameter. This can contain and objects. (e.g. UploadFilesAsync(zipFileSystem, "", false, new string[] {@"/file1", @"/folder/file2", @"dir1" }, ...) or UploadFilesAsync(zipFileSystem, "", false, new object[] {@"/temp/file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 }, ...))

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.DownloadFilesAsync(System.String,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,ComponentPro.ExtendedAsyncCompletedEventHandler{ComponentPro.IO.FileSystemTransferStatistics},System.Object)
member.summary: Asynchronously downloads files from the specified remote directory to the local directory.
member.param: The path and name of the remote directory where the files will be downloaded to the local folder. This parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are downloaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be downloaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be downloaded. If "/mydir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "/mydir" will be downloaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the remote directory should be downloaded. The final search condition depends on the and settings of the parameter. If this value ends with '>', the containing directory will also be downloaded. For example, if "/folder>" is used, files and subdirectories of "/folder" directory and itself will be downloaded; the destination directory will contain "folder" directory and its contents. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!
The path of the local directory to receive files from the server.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
An optional asynchronous callback to be invoked when this operation completes. This parameter can be null.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An asynchronous reference to a object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

For example: DownloadFiles("/MyDir/*.txt", true, "/ZipDir", true) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is created in "ZipDir" and all files and dirs within "MyDir" are copied to "ZipDir/MyDir"; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not created in "ZipDir", only files and subdirectories within "MyDir" are copied to "ZipDir".

If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be downloaded. If "/mydir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "/mydir" will be downloaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the remote directory should be downloaded. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!

Indicates whether all files and subdirectories will be transferred.

A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An asynchronous reference to a object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be downloaded. If "/mydir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "/mydir" will be downloaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the remote directory should be downloaded. The final search condition depends on the and settings of the parameter. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!

Indicates whether the containing directory should also be created in the destination directory. For example: DownloadFiles("/MyDir/*.txt", true, null, zipSystem, "/ZipDir" ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is created in "ZipDir" and all files and dirs within "MyDir" are copied to "ZipDir/MyDir"; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not created in "ZipDir", only files and subdirectories within "MyDir" are copied to "ZipDir".

The list of files and directories to download, or null to transfer files in the that match the search condition specified in the parameter. This list can contain and objects. (e.g. DownloadFiles("", false, new string[] {"file1", "file2", "dir1" }...) or DownloadFiles("", false, new object[] {"file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 }...))

A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.

member.summary: Initiates an asynchronous operation to terminate the USER session and purge all account information. The session will be reset to the default settings and the connection is left open.

A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.

remarks.p: Represents FTP REIN command.
This is identical to the state immediately after the connection is opened. A USER command may be issued to login.
The REIN command is unsupported by many FTP servers and not supported correctly by most FTP proxies. Its usage is not recommended. Use / instead.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.Cancel
member.summary: Cancels the current operation.

remarks.p: This method cancels the current operation. When data is being transferred, calling this method causes the object to attempt to abort the data transfer gracefully. If the property is enabled, the method will send the ABOR command to the FTP server. If the property is enabled and the current operation is a file download, the method will send Telnet interrupt signal to an FTP server.
The method can also be used to abort other processes. For example, this method can be used to abort lengthly multiple-file transfer, multiple-file deletion processes, etc.
If the property is not Ready state, you might need to call the to set it back to the Ready state.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.Cancel(System.Object)

member.param: A user-provided object that identifies the operation.
member.return: true if an operation is being cancelled; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.GetDownloadStream(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a direct access to the readonly data stream being received.
member.param: The filename of the file to retrieve. Some FTP servers may be case-sensitive.
member.returns: A Stream for reading data from the remote file.

remarks.p: Because the FTP protocol does not support processing multiple commands or transfers at the same time, the stream has to be closed before any other FTP operation can be used.

By default, the file will be retrieved from the current working directory. If you want to retrieve the file from another location, you could use the methods to change the current working directory. Absolute paths can also be provided, however some FTP servers might not support absolute paths and different server types may have different ways of representing absolute paths. The current working directory can be retrieved via the method.

member.exception: is null reference (Nothing in VB.NET).
is empty or contains illegal path characters.
An error occurred while getting download stream of the remote file on the server.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.CreateDirectory(System.String)
member.summary: Create a directory on the FTP server.
member.param: The name of the directory to create. Some FTP servers may be case-sensitive.

remarks.p: This method implements FTP MKD command.

By default, the directory will be created in the current working directory. If you want to create the directory in another location, you could use the methods to change the current working directory. Absolute paths can also be provided, however some FTP servers might not support absolute paths and different server types may have different ways of representing absolute paths. The current working directory can be retrieved via the method.

CAUTION: The reply codes for MKD command represents the absolute path of the freshly created directory as stated in RFC 959. However, many FTP servers do not comply to the requirement. In this case, the method returns a null reference.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.ClearCommandChannel
member.summary: Clears the command channel after login to facilitate firewall NAT when connecting using a secure data channel. This reverts the protected control connection back to plaintext connection.

remarks.p: This method implements the FTP CCC (Clear Command Channel) command.
This command is used in circumstances where it is desirable to protect the control connection only during authentication, when user credentials are being sent by the client.
When the control connection is reverted to plaintext, subsequent data transfers will be protected with the current settings.

member.exception: when the current connection was not secured (using Implicit or Explicit security mode).

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.Authenticate(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Authenticates the user to the FTP server to which it is connected using the specified username and password.
member.param: The username with which to login into the FTP server.
The password with which to login into the FTP server.

remarks.p: The FTP client must be connected to the FTP server using the Connect method prior to calling this method. The Login method will send the USER, PASS and ACCT commands to the FTP server.
This method represents FTP USER/PASS command pair.
If the userName parameter is a null reference or empty, "anonymous" is used. If the password parameter is a null reference or empty, "user@anonymous.com" is used.

member.returns: The logon message returned by the remote server.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.Reinitialize
member.summary: Terminates the USER session and purge all account information. The session will be reset to the default settings and the connection is left open.

remarks.p: Represents FTP REIN command.
This is identical to the state immediately after the connection is opened. A USER command may be issued to login.
The REIN command is unsupported by many FTP servers and not supported correctly by most FTP proxies. Its usage is not recommended. Use / instead.

member.exception: Reinitialize is not supported by this server at this time. Server is in implicit security mode.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.AsciiFileSearchConditions
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of ASCII search conditions.
member.remarks: When this property is not null the component automatically uses ASCII transfer type for the files with names that match one of the ASCII file search conditions as ASCII files.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.ReconnectionMaxRetries
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of retries for reconnection.
member.remarks: By default this value is 0 (the library does not try to reconnect to the server when the connection is lost). When the connection is lost, the component will try to reconnect to the server. If the number of retries exceed this value, the class will report the connection error.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.ReconnectionFailureDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay in milliseconds between failed login attempts for reconnection.
member.remarks: By default this value is 5000 (5 secs). When the connection is lost, the component will try to reconnect to the server. If the number of retries exceed the , the class will report the connection error.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.ComponentPro#IO#IRemoteFileSystem#PathNormalization
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to normalize path before any file or directory operation. Default value is true.
member.remarks: Set this to false if an operation fails due to the invalid normalized path or file path should be sent to the server as-is without adding the current directory to the beginning of the file path.

member.name: E:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.ReconnectionErrorChecking
member.summary: Occurs when the file system has encountered an error and need to determine whether the it should reconnect to the server.
member.remarks: This event is fired when the file system has encountered an error and need to determine whether the it should reconnect to the server or the method is called.

member.name: E:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.Reconnecting
member.summary: Occurs when the file system has encountered an error and trying to reconnect to the server.

member.name: E:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.Reconnected
member.summary: Occurs when the file system encountered an error and reconnected to the server.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.EncounteredFatalError
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether the client object has encountered a fatal error.
member.value: true if the client has tried and failed to reconnect to the server with the number of retries specified in ; otherwise false.

member.summary: Indicates whether to enable features for high-speed network connection. This may improve the transfer speed.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.KeepAliveDuringTransferInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval, in seconds, at which a NOOP command is sent on the command channel during a file transfer. Default value is 0 - NOOP commands are not sent during a file transfer.
member.value: The number of seconds to wait before sending a NOOP command during a file transfer, or 0(zero) to disable sending NOOP commands during a file transfer.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.KeepAliveDuringIdleInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of interval, in seconds, between NOOP commands sent by while idle. Set to 0 to disable sending NOOP commands.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.ForceMdtm
member.summary: Indicates whether to force MDTM command to be always used by instead of MLST (which is used when available by default).

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.As400DateFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the listing date format on AS/400 like systems. Format is 'DMY' for day,month,year; 'MDY' for month, day, year; and so on.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.DisableAs400NameFormatCommand
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the `SITE NAMEFMT 1` is used when AS/400 system is detected. Default is false - to use the `SITE NAMEFMT 1` command.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.SslUpgradeType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of TLS/SSL initialization for explicit TLS/SSL mode.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.SslReuseSessions
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to reuse TLS/SSL sessions for data transfers. Default value is true.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.SendTelnetInterruptSignal
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to send Telnet interrupt signal to an FTP server when aborting download. RFC 959 and RFC 1123 recommend sending IP and Synch signals before the ABOR command. This allows an FTP server to be notified that the connection will be terminated.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.SendAbortCommand
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to send the ABOR command when aborting download.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.ReuseControlConnectionSession
member.summary: Indicates whether to re-use control connection session ID for data connections.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.DetectFeatures

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.OverridePassiveModeIpAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to override an IP address announced by the server in response to PASV command with an IP used by the control connection. This is only active when not connected through a proxy.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.PauseBeforeUploadClose
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to pause before closing the encrypted upload.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.ForceListHiddenFiles

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.EnableControlConnectionFlushing

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.ConnectPassiveLater

member.summary: Gets supported features.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.ChangeDirectoryBeforeListing
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to force the , and methods to change directory before listing directory.
member.remarks: When this option is set to true, the Ftp class changes the current working directory before listing a remote directory while transferring or deleting files. You can set this option to true for highly compatible with all FTP servers, but it takes more time for changing directories in the , and methods. If you are certain that your FTP server supports absolute path, this option can be set to false.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.ChangeDirectoryBeforeFileOperation
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to force the , and methods to change directory before transferring files.
member.remarks: When this option is set to true, the Ftp class changes the current working directory before transferring or deleting files. You can set this option to true for highly compatible with almost FTP servers, but it takes more time for changing directories in the , and methods. If you are certain that your FTP server supports absolute path, this option can be set to false.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.Features
member.summary: Gets the list of FTP features that represent supported and enabled features documented in RFC 2389.
member.value: Extensions supported by the server.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.LocalEndPoint
member.summary: Gets the local client .
member.value: The that the component is using for communications.
member.remarks: The property gets an that contains the local IP address and port number to which your Socket is bound. You must cast this to an before retrieving any information. You can then call the IPEndPoint.Address method to retrieve the local IPAddress, and the IPEndPoint.Port method to retrieve the local port number.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.RemoteEndPoint
member.summary: Gets the remote server .
member.value: The with which the Socket is communicating.
member.remarks: If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, the RemoteEndPoint property gets the EndPoint that contains the remote IP address and port number to which the Socket is connected. If you are using a connectionless protocol, RemoteEndPoint contains the default remote IP address and port number with which the Socket will communicate. You must cast this EndPoint to an IPEndPoint before retrieving any information. You can then call the IPEndPoint.Address method to retrieve the remote IPAddress, and the IPEndPoint.Port method to retrieve the remote port number.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.State
member.summary: Gets the current state of the object.
member.value: The current state.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.TransferState
member.summary: Gets the current transfer state of the object.
member.value: The current transfer state.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.ServerType
member.summary: Gets the detected server type.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value, in milliseconds, indicating after what period of time an FTP operation (sending commands, waiting for responses or time between data buffer transfers) should timeout. Specify -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out.
member.remarks: By default, this property is set to 60000 (60 seconds). Minimal value is 1000.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.AbortTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value, in milliseconds, indicating after what period of time an FTP abort operation should timeout.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.DataAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets the IP address announced to the FTP server when establishing an active mode data transfer.
member.value: IP address.
member.remarks: By default, the value of this property is which means that the address of the listening interface is used instead. This has no effect for passive mode transfers.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.DataPortRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the local TCP port range used for data transfers. Please note that is usually only useful for active mode (see ), not in passive mode, where only the port range specified at the server is usually important. In passive mode, only set this property if you know precisely what you are doing, because setting it to a range that is too small or corresponds to the server range might often lead to inability to transfer many files!
member.value: The port range.
member.remarks: To set FTP port when connecting, please use the method.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.Security
member.summary: Gets or sets FTP security settings.
member.value: FTP security settings.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.MaxDownloadSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed download speed, in kilobytes. For unlimited speed, set this to zero.
member.value: Maximum allowed download speed.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.MaxUploadSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed upload speed, in kilobytes. For unlimited speed, set this to zero.
member.value: Maximum allowed upload speed.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Ftp.Passive
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating if the FTP client should initiate the data connection rather than the FTP server.
member.value: The file transfer type. Default is true (passive).

remarks.p: When using HTTP CONNECT proxy, this property is ignored and all transfers are passive.

If set to true (Passive mode), the PASV command will be sent to the FTP server rather than the PORT command resulting in the FTP server "listening" on a data port (other than its default) and waiting for a data connection to be established by the FTP client.

If set to false (Active mode), the PORT command will be sent and the FTP client will be listening for an incoming data connection. The FTP server will establish the data connection upon receipt of a transfer command. The reply to the PASV command includes the host and port address the FTP server is listening on.
If you are having issues connecting or sending and receiving files to and from a server, try setting the Passive property to true.

member.value: The file transfer mode. Default is Stream.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.FtpWebRequest.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the time-out value (in milliseconds) for a request.

remarks.p: The length of time, in milliseconds, until the request times out, or the value of -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out. Default is -1.

Timeout is the number of milliseconds that a synchronous request made with the method waits for a response, and the methods waits for a stream. If a resource does not respond within the time-out period, the request throws a with the Status property set to Timeout.
The Timeout property has no effect on asynchronous requests made with the or methods.
Minimal value is 1000. Setting this to a value lower than 1000 will set it to 1000.
